div.p: Greetings. John Heinrich returns to you, whom you recommended to me in your letters.

He certainly conducted himself most honorably with us. Indeed, I would have wished to accomplish more for his and your sake, but success does not always correspond to our wishes. As far as I am concerned, never will anyone come from there recommended to me by you, who will not be most welcome. Therefore, never doubt my mind and will towards you.
I wish and desire that everything may turn out prosperous and happy for you and your churches. Nothing more at present.
Farewell and be well with the entire assembly of the pious. London, June 10, 1562.
Most devoted to your piety, F. Bedford. To the most distinguished man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, most faithful minister of the Church of Zurich. Zurich.
